title: Advancement Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lindenwood University
Interview Descriptions: Standard application process. First round interview was done via video call. Second round interview was an in-person half day on campus with several staff members. Third round was another in-person meeting.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Lindenwood?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Lindenwood University (Saint Charles, MO) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was incredibly disappointing. I try to take everything with a grain of salt, and rarely feel compelled to leave reviews, however, proceed with caution if you're looking to change jobs quickly, or receive timely communication about a position. There was virtually no communication with the marketing department prior to an interview request, which took over a month. The interview itself was so bland, so cut and dry that I can't imagine anyone having the opportunity to truly show their personality and work with basic run-of-the-mill questions. The interviewer clearly showed no interest in learning more and having a conversation, but rather rushed through the questions and got me off the phone.
Interview Questions: Generic questions, and things insinuating that I had no experience when I very clearly had 4+ years of experience for the position.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lindenwood University (Saint Charles, MO) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Met with my supervisor once before hired and then aslo after and we talked about the role, expectations and my availability. It was very easy process and I enjoyed my job while I was there.
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of this job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lindenwood University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was super easy. You usually go through 2 short interviews. They asked very basic questions, like where you live, how you commute, and what your availability is. One question they asked was what you think a good administrative assistant is. You know right after if you are hired or not
Interview Questions: what do you think a good administrative assistant is

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lindenwood University
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and was made to feel comfortable. All my questions were answered with knowledge and understanding. Interviewing practiced active listening skills. Their questions asked of me were relevant to the job and some were of the behavioral type.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with conflict in the workplace.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lindenwood University
Interview Descriptions: Personal, and closed session usually no more than three interviewers. The team is very athletic so talk sports and being goal focused but team oriented.  The job requires you to call and email a ton with several follow ups and note  taking, so if you have experience in this I recommend sharing.
Interview Questions: Why Transfer Admissions at a Private University?

title: IT Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lindenwood University
Interview Descriptions: Simple questions about your former job and testing your skills with technical questions . They also give you time to prepare and they are friendly as well. Darm too much stuff to write here. It was an easy experience I believe and it's also a starting point for others
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lindenwood University in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on the website for the position and got a phone call about a week later. The first interview was on Zoom, with a seven person panel, and then me on the other end. That was the first round.  I was honestly surprised at most of the questions and how little they had to do with my actual knowledge of and practice in the subject area. They were much more abstract questions and many were focused on diversity. The questions weren't HARD, they were just not at all what I expected. 

** I'm waiting to hear back from the second round, so I chose "no" for get an offer as I have not received one yet.**
Interview Questions: How would you bring diversity to the department?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Lindenwood University
Interview Descriptions: In person Interview with the boss at her office. Very welcome and kind person. Apply for the job in the Student worker office, fill application process. Set up an interview. No need for specific dressing.
Interview Questions:
Do you have any experience?
Time Flexibility?

title: Grad Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict with a coworker.

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lindenwood University (Saint Charles, MO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: interview process was typical of other interviews. Supervisor was rude and unprofessional and did not seem like he was happy with his job and did not seem to really care about the position and made it see like it was unimportant.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Lindenwood University (Belleville, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was an overall good experience.  There was a phone screening with targeted appropriate questions.  The phone interview was followed by a committee interview which included a tour of campus.  All of the participants were pleasant, engaged and helpful.  The final interview was a 1:1 with the campus president.  He shared important information about the needs of the campus and seemed highly energized and engaged.  There were several scheduling issues in getting through the process.  I would have liked to see that better organized.
Interview Questions: The group asked how they could attract more adult students.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lindenwood University (Saint Charles, MO) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted all my records and was interviewed on the phone initially for approximately thirty minutes.  I was then scheduled to do a face to face interview.  The face to face was approximately a week later then I received the offer in email.
Interview Questions: Asked about my academic records and professional work background.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lindenwood University (Saint Charles, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I was referred, qualified because I had the degree. Basically got hired after the director met me. I simply emailed them and then got a reply. They wanted to meet me, and then I met and was able to get the job right away, but it was based on whether they had classes available for me to teach or not.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lindenwood University (Belleville, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with Dr. Manjounes, who was outstanding in recognizing and placing applicants in the area of humanities according to class requirements.  She asked questions about my past teaching experiences .  She listened and offered me a position as long as the numbers would make for the class.  It took one quarter before a section opened for me.  Shortly after, she asked me if I would be willing to work in Communications.  The Division Chair also asked if I would be willing to teach in the English department where they needed help with Composition classes and Introduction to Literature.  I accepted both times.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute to teaching in the ADP program that has three subjects to cover from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
